intro: Notodon, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Melanthiaceae. It is characterized by its perennial herbaceous growth habit and distinctive, often showy flowers. The leaves are typically basal, forming a rosette, and are usually lance-shaped with a waxy texture. The flowers are usually arranged in umbels and can be white, green, or purple in color. Notodon species are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere and are often found in woodland or meadow habitats.
